@Agustarson @speakeasydev 5) How many different languages/runtimes is your API being used in - most people dont track analytics for client sdks or even have them but this can really give you  direction on which developer user community to invest in

RT @Agustarson: Are there any API product managers around?

Would love to hear any experience of managing APIs as products.

@Agustarson @speakeasydev 4) Average number of new API keys per day - indicates how quickly API usage is growing within a target customer company/team. Are more and more integrations being built by a customer or is it just one touch point ?
@Agustarson @speakeasydev 3) Rate % of successful requests vs. unsuccessful sync requests:  Good indication of whether the API aligns with the stated value proposition of your product
@Agustarson @speakeasydev 2) Number of actively daily/monthly users - this is an indication of product growth and in a very simple sense if your API usage is growing
@Agustarson @speakeasydev 1) "Time to 200": how long it takes for a new user to experience their first API call
@Agustarson @speakeasydev Thanks ! yeah there are some key metrics that continue to come up in customer conversations:

#openapi is an extremely flexible API description format. That's great for covering corner cases, but can be paralyzing to devs just getting started. @reefbarman is kicking of a series of posts showcasing best practices so you can wrangle this rich but confusing ecosystem. https://t.co/UbP2xshSYh
